ftc.team6460.javadeck.api.motion.impl

Class ServoFeedbackMotor

  • java.lang.Object
    • ftc.team6460.javadeck.api.motion.impl.ServoFeedbackMotor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Maintainable, EffectorPeripheral<java.lang.Double>, RobotPeripheral, SensorPeripheral<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Void>

    public abstract class ServoFeedbackMotor
extends java.lang.Object
implements EffectorPeripheral<java.lang.Double>, SensorPeripheral<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Void>
    A motor that can reach a specific absolute position, and optionally maintain it (compensating for external forces as needed)

    • Constructor Detail

      • ServoFeedbackMotor

        public ServoFeedbackMotor(AntiStallFilter inner,
                          double correctionFactor,
                          double maxPower,
                          double maxErrorTolerance)
        Constructs a new motor.
        Parameters:
        inner - The motor to use
        correctionFactor - A correction factor specifying how fast to correct, and in which direction. Positive means positive power causes an increase in encoder reading. Negative means that a positive power causes encoder readings to decrease.
        maxPower - The maximum drive power acceptable for this motor.
        maxErrorTolerance - The maximum deviation, in encoder counts between the goal and actual, that is allowed.

      • setHoldAtPosition

        public void setHoldAtPosition(boolean holdAtPosition)
        Specifies whether this servo should hold at its final position
        Parameters:
        holdAtPosition - True if the motor should maintain its goal position after it reaches it, false if it should shut down after reaching its goal.

        Parameters:
        nanos - The number of nanoseconds for the shutdown to stay in effect. If any exception is thrown, the state of the effector is unknown. Depending on its role, the program may take other actions.

      • addSafetyGroup

        public void addSafetyGroup(SafetyGroup grp)
        Description copied from interface: EffectorPeripheral
        Adds this effector to the given safety group. This method may be called multiple times. This should establish a reference to that group, so that if this effector is found to be in an unsafe state, the groups it belongs to can be notified.
        Specified by:
        addSafetyGroup in interface EffectorPeripheral<java.lang.Double>
        Parameters:
        grp - The safety group that this effector is being added to.

        Specified by:
        calibrate in interface SensorPeripheral<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Void>

        val - The value to calibrate to.

        java.lang.InterruptedException - If interrupted waiting for the sensor to read its value.
